title: Verified Purchase
content: A historical novel detailing illustrious life of Arabella Huntington from poverty following the Civil War to a determined woman of immense wealth, talent and taste.  Most of the novel takes place in the Gilded Age on the outsides of the inner circle of the snobbish New York 400 set. Luxurious descriptions of European capitals, period costumes and family hostilities hampering for the highest perch governing the railroad and related companies.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2024

title: Captivating
content: Shana Abe brought to life the Gilded age in all its glory, with a magnificent telling of Belle Huntington a woman who rose from nothing to become a woman of great wealth and who lived by her own rules taking her life fully in to her own hands. I doubt I would have ever known about this true story if it weren’t for this wonderful book

title: An American Beauty by Shana Abe
content: The story of the great railroad giant, H. P. Huntington and the woman who was most influential in his life. Arabella is one exceptionally motivated woman whose life is amazing to learn about. If you love history told in chapters that will keep you turning the pages, this book will not disappoint you. An excellent and enlightening book!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: Arabella is Working to support her family in 1867 Richmond. The war is over but people have suffered and her father has died. She has 4 brothers and sisters to look after plus her mother. She meets Collis Huntington while working and one night hides herself and him from a raid. She goes to New York and her family goes with her but they are each settled into house with servants by Mr Huntington. So begins the life they will share even though he is married. This is the story of that life together and how it went from mistress to wife. How they had a son together and how she fell in love with his nephew. If you like history and you have visited the Huntington Library in California then you will be interested in the Huntington family. Thank you for the chance to win this book through Goodread.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024

title: A very good read...
content: This is a very good read about a historic person as long as you recognize that it is a fictionalized version.

title: Great Book
content: When I was a 5th grade teacher in Los Angeles I would take my classes to the Huntington Library in San Marino, California for field trips.  This book opened a world for me I never could have imagined and now I know the history of how the Huntington family came to create such a marvel.  The writer beautifully described in a very detailed way what life was like during this time period.  It is an enchanting story.

title: Verified Purchase

Loved this so much I’m sad it’s over.

content: I don’t write reviews often but I want to for this fictionalization of the history if Arabella Huntington, and of the Huntington family and all that it gave to the country. If you have’s been to Huntington Library in Pasadena, CA, referenced in the last part of the book abut Edward’s success and his pour chase and development of this extraordinary house and gardens, you can’t imagine what people were able to do in that era when a few people had simply enormous wealth, and following the war, a lot of people had nothing.  Arabella’s ability trove through her awful circumstances and develop into an astute businesswoman, art collector, and finally, the assistance he provided

title: Verified Purchase
content: In this historical novel of America’s Gilded  Age when America birthed millionaires while millions struggled to survive , the main character is a mistress who refuses to feel the moral guilt demanded by the prevailing culture. The reader is swept along as Belle is lifted from poverty to  an interesting life of wealth, opulence, and commitment, described by the author in beautiful language, as Belle tries to find the grace to live in a culture that reviles her. She values money, family, and beauty and strives to elevate those values by the choices she makes. Those of us who frequent Huntington Gardens and Museums get to enjoy her legacy and will particularly enjoy reading about this fascinating, independent woman.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2023

title: The Gilded and the Guilted
content: Dear Ms Abe,
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023

title: Verified Purchase
content: Just two weeks ago I read your novel on the life of Isabella Stewart Gardner and relished the story ,but this is your Masterpiece!! Being from an old southern family who struggled greatly after the Civil War every detail “ rang true” in this odyssey of a young girl who saved her family in whatever ways were open to her . Having taught history for many years all of your small details are perfectly and accrately rendered. Thank you ,thank you , I will not soon forget this electrifying and brilliantly written tale . You have a great gift.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2024

title: Electrifyingly and brilliantly written !!!
content: This book was very readable, but more speculative than much actual historic substance.  For an author to be in the mind of a real person is challenging, and the author did this quite well.  The late in the book, limited reveal about how awful it was for teenage Arabella was mostly left to the imagination.  Leaves one wondering what grit it must have taken for her to survive it at all, and sympathize more fully with the choices she made just to survive.  Having been entranced by the amazing Huntington Gardens near Pasadena, I was left wanting more real information about the Huntington’s, but honestly that wasn’t the point of this novel.  If one has an interest in gilded age New York and the toll this era took on poor women’s lives, Edith Wharton’s novels The House of Mirth and The Custom of the Country are highly recommended.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: All through the book I looked for a certain thing to be revealed. The last chapter gave a surprising and good ending.

title: Readable

It's so much better when you can connect places and people with the stories you read.

title: well done

post_time: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I just finished this latest Shana Abe Historical romance set in the Gilded Age, at first in the South after the war, when everyone was just trying to survive, and later in New York and Texas with visits to Europe for shopping expeditions. Belle's story, with her affair and marriages and cunning plans to keep her entire family fed and sheltered in style, is amazing and a testament to what being a strong woman means, or meant in that time period (or really, in any time period...women hold up the world for so many). Abe's prose is pure gold, and it flows elegantly along her page-turner of a plot with it's brilliant characters to a pleasing finish. I've read everything Ms Abe has written, and I've yet to be disappointed. Excellent book, highly recommended.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2023

title: Page turner
content: I had never heard of Arabella Huntington before reading this book. I was blown away at how she charted her own way during times when women were not given that luxury.
